column4: I cannot seem to mount and/or view contents of a CD. I have been to /media/cdrom0 & cdrom1 ... using a "legit" music cd ... and nothing shows up under either dir
music cd's don't mount like that ...
Was orginially attempting to mount the Quake III CD to follow instructions from a post. I resorted to the music disk as i figured the Q3 disk might be the issue
hm, if you load the quake III disk you don't see an icon on the desktop?
Correct. No icon on desktop. That is why I navigated to the /media dir
ok, take out the cd, open a terminal, and type    tail -f /var/log/syslog  in the terminal. That will show a log of what happens when you put the cd back in.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/36754/
ok, now put the cd back in, there'll be some more text
It did not update after putting the CD back in.
that is not good, the kernel doesn't even see your cd drive. And I am no kernel guru.
Btw, nor did i close the term window or terminate the command
you read my mind :)
If it means anything, husband just updated to Gutsy, clean install.
ah, ask in #ubuntu+1 , that may be a known issue
+ one
Which version are you running, btw?
gutsy
I was actually happy in Feisty. I managed to get my extra mouse buttons, extra keyboard buttons working. And read/write to the NTFS.
And I had found a way to make my speakers actually work in 5.1 which i am having to relearn now. :P
I'm used to : 5.1? I am jealous
Would it work attempting to mount the drive in terminal?
